availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
10
The Governor commissioned Henry C. Hogg Colonel and Zachariah Morgan Lieut Colonel of the county of Perry duly elected.
He appointed A. C. Nowell Comr of Deeds for Tennessee (Nashville)
He appointed John R. Stivers a Justice of the Peace for the County of Bourbon District No 4 in place of B. F. Harris resigned
He issued a Warrant for the apprehension of Henry Parrish charged with murder under a Requisition of the Governor of Illinois
He remitted the Judgment of the Owen Circuit Court ordering T. T. Swetman to six months confienment in the County Jail for shooting without wounding.

Decr 10
The Governer remitted to M. V. Daniels that portion of a judgment of the Lexington City Court requiring his confinement in the County Jail Six months and respited the fine of $50. for six months for cutting in sudden heat and passion
He respited for twelve months the following Judgments

row.cell: Mason Cir. Ct. vs. Busby & Essex --

body.p: He remitted the following Judgments, to wit.

row.cell: Carroll Cir. Ct. vs. T. D Evans & others --
Carter J. P. " " " J. P. Rose
